data.enText: one of the short stiff hairs or wires in a brush

data.chText: （对某人的言行）大为恼怒；被激怒
data.enText: to suddenly become very annoyed or offended at what sb says or does

data.chText: 他的谎话使她火冒三丈。
data.enText: His lies made her bristle with rage.

data.chText: （背部或颈部的毛因惊吓或发怒）竖起，耸起
data.enText: to stand up on the back and neck because the animal is frightened or angry
to contain a large number of sth
The whole subject bristles with problems.

means: (背部或颈部的毛因惊吓或发怒)竖起，耸起

ex.enText: I must have my hair cut.

ex.chText: 我们的狗把黑毛弄得地板上到处都是。
ex.enText: Our dog has left black hairs all over the floor.

synonyms.bx: 指人或动物身上的毛，但主要指人的头发。

ex.chText: 他的下巴上长满了胡子茬。
ex.enText: His chin was covered with bristles.

ex.chText: 这种刷子是用动物的鬃毛制作的。
ex.enText: This brush is made of animal bristles.
It is as light as a feather.
The cat has soft white fur.

ex.chText: 它是棕色的，但是它的毛发梢是银色的。
ex.enText: It is brown, but the tips of its fur are silver.

synonyms.bx: 指某些动物身上的柔软细毛。

ex.chText: 这匹马的鬃毛非常漂亮。
ex.enText: The mane of the horse is very beautiful.

ex.chText: 她长着一头又长又密的黑发。
ex.enText: She has a rich mane of black hair.

synonyms.bx: 指马颈上的鬃毛或狮子头部及颈上的鬣毛；也指人浓密的长发。

ex.chText: 这件衣服是纯羊毛的吗？
ex.enText: Is this garment made of pure wool?

ex.chText: 这些羊是专为剪取羊毛而饲养的。
ex.enText: These sheep are specially bred for their wool.

synonyms.bx: 指羊或某些动物身上的绒或毛。

data.enText: to contain a large number of sth
The whole subject bristles with problems.

tr: a stiff fiber (coarse hair or filament)
react in an offended or angry manner
example: He bristled at her suggestion that he should teach her how to use the program
It was a sight to make one's hair uprise!

tr: have or be thickly covered with or as if with bristles
be in a state of movement or action
example: The room abounded with screaming children

value.def: Bristles are the short hairs that grow on a man's chin after he has shaved. The hairs on the top of a man's head can also be called bristles when they are cut very short.

example.tran: 两天没剃长出的胡子茬儿

example.ex: He rubbed his hands over the soft bristles of his crew cut.
example.tran: 他用双手摸了摸他平头上柔软的短发。

value.tran: 胡子茬儿；（胡须剃后长出的）粗硬短须；（男子头顶处的）短发

value.def: The bristles of a brush are the thick hairs or hair-like pieces of plastic which are attached to it.

example.ex: As soon as the bristles on your toothbrush begin to wear, throw it out.
example.tran: 牙刷毛一开始磨损，就把它扔掉。

value.def: Bristles are thick, strong animal hairs that feel hard and rough.

example.ex: It has a short stumpy tail covered with bristles.
example.tran: 它粗短的尾巴上鬃毛浓密。

value.def: If the hair on a person's or animal's body bristles, it rises away from their skin because they are cold, frightened, or angry.

example.ex: It makes the hairs at the nape of the neck bristle...
Cats yowl. My dog's hair bristles in response.
example.tran: 这些猫的哀叫引得我的狗毛发竖立。

value.tran: （因寒冷、恐惧或愤怒）毛发直立

value.def: If you bristle at something, you react to it angrily, and show this in your expression or the way you move.

example.ex: Ellis bristles at accusations that Berkeley's experiment is ill-conceived...
example.tran: 埃利斯对有人指责伯克利的实验考虑不够周密感到气愤。

example.ex: He bristled with indignation at the suggestion that he was racist.
example.tran: 有人暗示他是个种族主义者，他对此十分恼火。

value.def: If you say that a place or thing bristles with people or with other things, you are emphasizing that it contains a great number of them.

example.ex: The country bristles with armed groups...
example.tran: 这个国家到处都是武装团伙。

example.ex: The idea fairly bristles with controversy...
example.tran: 这个想法存有诸多争议。

example.ex: Their vocabulary bristles fashionably with talk of federalism.
example.tran: 他们开口闭口都是联邦制度，满口时髦词汇。
